intro: Elaeodendron croceum, commonly known as the yellow elaeodendron, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
